text: I would also like to act, once in a while, but not get up every morning at 5:30 or six o'clock and pound into the studio and get home at 7:30 or eight o'clock at night, or act over and over and over every night on Broadway, either.
author: Jackie Cooper

text: If you can miss getting up in the morning and running into a wall, I miss playing football. I'll never be a frustrated athlete.
author: Brian Bosworth

text: I like everything perfect. Everything has to be neat. My sister is 5, and she's more messy than I am. I make my bed every morning, everything's perfect. My shoes are all arranged. It's sad. I'm a little like Ray, a little bit.
author: Dakota Fanning

text: It says something about this new global economy that USA Today now reports every morning on the day's events in Asian markets.
author: Lawrence Summers

text: I had been found in a mud puddle at 4:30 in the morning.
author: Lance Loud
